ground_truth: A limo is parked beside a private airliner that bears the Donovan corporate logo. Brody peers inside to Donovan and Indy, who opens the Grail Diary and thoughtfully turns through the pages. Their journey is SUPERIMPOSED over a map tracing a course from New York City to Venice, Italy. Indy and Brody disembark from the Water Bus onto the Boat Landing as other gondoliers steer their boats in the water. Suddenly, a woman with attractive features, blonde hair, and bright, intelligent eyes approaches Indy, looking at him with an appraising expression that is brazenly flirtatious. Indy grins, enjoying the repartee. The woman turns to Brody, who tips his hat. She introduces herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider and extends her hand to Brody. Indy's grin fades, and Brody registers a look of surprise. Indy, Brody, and Elsa walk along the narrow canal, lined with buildings on either side. As they cross over a bridge to the opposite side of the canal, Indy steals a flower from a street vendor and holds it out to Elsa. She hands Indy a slip of paper, which he then extends to Brody. Elsa leads them into a large piazza where people walk about and sit at tables in front of a large building, arriving at the front steps of the library. Elsa leads the way inside, and their heels click across the marble floor. Indy and Brody notice that the library contains many stained-glass windows. Elsa indicates four huge marble columns that go from floor to ceiling. Indy glances at the columns, then notices a stained-glass window depicting a Knight of the Crusades, lingering for a moment in front of the window. Once Elsa is out of earshot, Indy quickly whips out the Grail Diary and opens it to the sketch he noticed on the airplane. Brody glances at the Diary and then at the window, noticing that the Roman numerals in question are part of the window's design. Indy's eyes dart across the walls and ceilings, charged with the thrill of discovery as they travel up one of the four huge marble columns. He points to the stained-glass window, discovering that each column is numbered with a Roman numeral. Indy hurries toward Column VII, points again to the stained-glass window, and looks down at the scrap of paper in his hands. He walks past aisles of book-lined shelves, stops, turns, and looks down. He climbs a spiral staircase leading up to a loft, looking down at Brody and Elsa. Indy then rushes down the staircase and goes to the center tile where the two sides of the X intersect.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A limousine is stationed next to a private jet that displays the Donovan business emblem. Brody gazes inside to Donovan and Indy, who opens the Grail Journal and thoughtfully flips through the pages. Their expedition is OVERLAID on a chart plotting a path from New York City to Venice, Italy. Indy and Brody alight from the Water Bus onto the Boat Dock as other gondoliers guide their vessels on the water. Instantly, a lady with alluring features, blonde hair, and bright, perceptive eyes nears Indy, gazing at him with a calculating look that is boldly playful. Indy smirks, relishing the banter. The lady turns to Brody, who tips his cap. She introduces herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider and extends her hand to Brody. Indy's smirk diminishes, and Brody shows a look of amazement. Indy, Brody, and Elsa stroll along the narrow waterway, bordered with constructions on either side. As they cross over a footbridge to the opposite part of the canal, Indy pilfers a blossom from a streetside merchant and presents it to Elsa. She hands Indy a piece of paper, which he then passes to Brody. Elsa guides them into a large square where individuals walk about and sit at tables in front of a large structure, arriving at the front steps of the library. Elsa leads the way inside, and their heels click across the marble ground. Indy and Brody notice that the library contains many stained-glass panes. Elsa indicates four colossal marble columns that rise from floor to ceiling. Indy looks at the columns, then notices a stained-glass pane portraying a Knight of the Crusades, pausing for a moment in front of the pane. Once Elsa is out of hearing range, Indy swiftly draws out the Grail Journal and opens it to the illustration he noticed on the plane. Brody glances at the Journal and then at the pane, observing that the Roman numerals in question are part of the pane's design. Indy's eyes flick across the walls and ceilings, filled with the thrill of revelation as they journey up one of the four colossal marble columns. He points to the stained-glass pane, discovering that each column is labeled with a Roman numeral. Indy rushes toward Column VII, points again to the stained-glass pane, and looks down at the slip of paper in his hands. He walks past aisles of book-lined racks, halts, turns, and looks down. He ascends a spiral staircase leading up to a loft, looking down at Brody and Elsa. Indy then dashes down the staircase and goes to the center tile where the two sides of the X cross.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A limo has been parked beside a private airliner that is bearing the Donovan corporate logo. The inside is peered into by Brody, who observes Donovan and Indy as the Grail Diary is opened by Indy and thoughtfully turned through by him. Their journey has been SUPERIMPOSED over a map that traces a course from New York City to Venice, Italy. The Water Bus is disembarked from by Indy and Brody onto the Boat Landing as other gondoliers steer their boats in the water. Suddenly, Indy is approached by a woman with attractive features, blonde hair, and bright, intelligent eyes, who looks at him with an appraising expression that brazenly flirts. The repartee is enjoyed by Indy, who grins. Brody is turned to by the woman, and his hat is tipped by him. She introduces herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider and extends her hand to Brody. Indy's grin fades, and a look of surprise is registered by Brody. Along the narrow canal lined with buildings on either side, Indy, Brody, and Elsa walk. As a bridge to the opposite side of the canal is crossed by them, a flower is stolen by Indy from a street vendor and held out to Elsa. A slip of paper is handed to Indy by her, which is then extended to Brody by him. Into a large piazza where people walk about and sit at tables in front of a large building, they are led by Elsa, arriving at the front steps of the library. Inside is led the way by Elsa, and the marble floor is clicked across by their heels. It is noticed by Indy and Brody that many stained-glass windows are contained by the library. Elsa indicates four huge marble columns going from floor to ceiling. The columns are glanced at by Indy, then a stained-glass window depicting a Knight of the Crusades is noticed by him, lingering for a moment in front of the window. Once Indy is out of earshot, he quickly whips out the Grail Diary and opens it to the sketch he noticed on the airplane. The Diary is glanced at by Brody, and then he looks at the window, noticing that the Roman numerals in question are part of the window's design. Across the walls and ceilings, Indy's eyes dart, charged with the thrill of discovery as one of the four huge marble columns is traveled up by them. The stained-glass window is pointed to by him, discovering that a Roman numeral numbers each column. Toward Column VII, Indy hurries, pointing again to the stained-glass window, and looking down at the scrap of paper in his hands. Past aisles of book-lined shelves, he walks, stops, turns, and looks down. A spiral staircase leading up to a loft is climbed by him, looking down at Brody and Elsa. Indy then rushes down the staircase and goes to the center tile where the two sides of the X intersect.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A limo is parked beside a private airliner with the Donovan logo. Brody peers in at Donovan and Indy, who examines the Grail Diary. Their journey is superimposed over a map from New York City to Venice, Italy. Indy and Brody disembark from a Water Bus onto the Boat Landing among gondoliers. A blonde woman with intelligent eyes approaches Indy flirtatiously. Indy grins, and she introduces herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider, shaking Brody's hand. Indy, Brody, and Elsa walk along a narrow canal lined with buildings. Crossing a bridge, Indy picks a flower for Elsa. She hands a slip of paper to Indy, who gives it to Brody. Elsa leads them to a piazza and the library steps. Inside, their heels click on the marble floor, noticing stained-glass windows and four marble columns. Indy lingers at a Crusader window, compares it to a Grail Diary sketch, and identifies Roman numerals in the design. Excited, he confirms each column has a Roman numeral. Indy rushes to Column VII, compares it to the paper, walks past shelves, ascends a spiral staircase, then descends to the center tile where the X intersects.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A limo sits beside a private airliner with the Donovan logo. Brody peers inside at Donovan and Indy, who flips through the Grail Diary. Their journey appears over a map from New York City to Venice. Disembarking from the Water Bus, Indy and Brody are approached by a flirtatious woman with blonde hair and bright eyes. Indy grins, Brody tips his hat, and she introduces herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider, shaking Brodyâ€™s hand. Indy's grin fades into surprise. Walking along the canal, Indy gives Elsa a flower he picks from a vendor, receiving a slip of paper he passes to Brody. Elsa leads them to a piazza, arriving at a library with stained-glass windows and four marble columns. Indy notices a Crusades Knight window, referencing a sketch from the airplane in the Grail Diary. Brody notices Roman numerals in the windowâ€™s design. Indy's eyes dart with discovery as he identifies the columns numbered with Roman numerals. He rushes to Column VII, checks the paper, climbs a spiral staircase, and then descends to the center tile where the X intersects.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A luxurious limousine is parked alongside a sleek private airliner, prominently displaying the distinctive Donovan corporate logo emblazoned on its side. Brody leans forward, peering inside the vehicle toward Donovan and Indy, who has opened the Grail Diary and is thoughtfully flipping through its well-worn pages. This part of their adventurous journey is visually SUPERIMPOSED over a detailed map, tracing a specific course from the bustling cityscape of New York City all the way to the historic and enchanting Venice, Italy. Upon arrival, Indy and Brody step off the Water Bus onto the bustling Boat Landing, where gondoliers expertly navigate their boats across the shimmering water. Suddenly, a striking woman with alluring features, radiant blonde hair, and bright, intelligent eyes makes her approach toward Indy, her gaze laden with an appraising expression that is unmistakably flirtatious in nature. Indy responds with a broad grin, relishing the playful exchange. The woman turns her attention to Brody, who courteously tips his hat. She introduces herself with poise as Dr. Elsa Schneider, extending a friendly hand to Brody. Indy's grin momentarily falters, and Brodyâ€™s face registers a look of genuine surprise. Together, Indy, Brody, and Elsa stroll along the narrow canal, framed on both sides by tall, elegant buildings. As they progress, they cross over a picturesque bridge to the opposite side of the canal. In a charming gesture, Indy plucks a vibrant flower from a street vendor and offers it to Elsa. In return, she hands Indy a slip of paper, which he then, in turn, passes to Brody. Elsa leads them with purpose into a bustling large piazza, where people wander casually and sit at cafÃ© tables positioned in front of a grand, impressive building, finally reaching the front steps of the library. Elsa confidently guides them inside, where the clicking of their heels resonates across the expansive marble floor. Indy and Brody take note of the library's many stunning stained-glass windows. Elsa points out four enormous marble columns that stretch majestically from the floor right up to the ceiling. Indy observes these columns with interest before his attention is captured by a stained-glass window depicting a Knight of the Crusades, and he pauses briefly in front of it, lingering as if lost in thought. Once Elsa is out of earshot, Indy swiftly pulls out the Grail Diary, opening it to the sketch he had previously noticed on the airplane. Brody glances at the Diary and then at the window, noticing that the Roman numerals are cleverly integrated into the window's intricate design. Indy's eyes move rapidly across the room, scanning the walls and ceilings, emanating the thrill of impending discovery as they trace up one of the four massive marble columns. He indicates the stained-glass window, realizing that each column is marked with a Roman numeral. Eagerly, Indy makes his way to Column VII, gesturing once more to the stained-glass window, and examines the scrap of paper in his hand. He walks briskly past rows of shelves filled with countless books, pauses, pivots, and looks downward. With determination, he ascends a spiral staircase leading up to an elevated loft, glancing down at Brody and Elsa below. Indy then rushes back down the staircase and advances decisively to the central tile where the two sides of the X come together in perfect intersection.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A luxurious limousine, with its polished exterior shining in the sunlight, is parked alongside a sleek and impressive private airliner, prominently displaying the distinctive Donovan corporate logo emblazoned on its side in bold lettering. Brody leans forward with keen interest, peering inside the spacious and elegant vehicle toward Donovan and Indy, who has opened the Grail Diary, its pages well-worn from use, and is thoughtfully flipping through them, absorbed in their contents. This particular segment of their adventurous journey is visually SUPERIMPOSED over a detailed and intricate map, tracing a specific course from the bustling cityscape and iconic skyline of New York City all the way to the historic and enchanting city of Venice, Italy. Upon arrival in the picturesque city, Indy and Brody step off the Water Bus onto the lively Boat Landing, where gondoliers expertly maneuver their iconic boats across the shimmering, reflective water. Suddenly, a striking woman with alluring features, radiant blonde hair cascading down, and bright, intelligent eyes makes her approach toward Indy, her gaze filled with an appraising expression that is unmistakably flirtatious in nature. Indy can't help but respond with a broad, delighted grin, clearly relishing the playful and intriguing exchange. The woman then shifts her attention to Brody, who courteously tips his hat in a polite gesture. She introduces herself with poise and grace as Dr. Elsa Schneider, extending a friendly hand to Brody. Indy's grin momentarily falters, replaced by a flicker of surprise, while Brodyâ€™s face registers a look of genuine astonishment. Together, Indy, Brody, and Elsa stroll along the narrow, winding canal, which is elegantly framed on both sides by tall, stately buildings. As they progress, they cross over a picturesque, arched bridge to the opposite side of the canal. In a charming gesture, Indy plucks a vibrant, colorful flower from a nearby street vendor and gallantly offers it to Elsa. In return, she hands Indy a slip of paper, which he then, in turn, passes to Brody, their silent communication infused with anticipation. Elsa leads them with purpose through the bustling large piazza, where people wander casually, enjoying the day, and sit at cafÃ© tables positioned in front of a grand, impressive building, finally reaching the front steps of the library. Elsa confidently guides them inside, where the clicking of their heels resonates across the expansive marble floor, echoing through the spacious interior. Indy and Brody take note of the library's many stunning stained-glass windows, their colorful designs casting patterns of light on the marble. Elsa points out four enormous marble columns that stretch majestically from the gleaming floor right up to the high ceiling. Indy observes these columns with interest, considering their significance, before his attention is captured by a stained-glass window portraying a Knight of the Crusades, causing him to pause briefly in front of it, lingering as if lost in thought, contemplating its meaning. Once Elsa is out of earshot, Indy swiftly pulls out the Grail Diary, opening it to the sketch that had previously caught his attention on the airplane. Brody glances at the Diary and then at the window, noticing that the Roman numerals are cleverly integrated into the window's intricate design. Indy's eyes move rapidly across the room, scanning the walls and ceilings with intent, emanating the thrill of impending discovery as they trace up one of the four massive marble columns. He indicates the stained-glass window deliberately, realizing that each column bears a Roman numeral. Eagerly, Indy makes his way to Column VII, gesturing once more to the stained-glass window, and examines the scrap of paper in his hand with renewed focus. He walks briskly past rows of shelves laden with countless books, pauses momentarily, pivots, and looks downward with determination. With resolve, he ascends a spiral staircase leading up to an elevated loft, glancing down at Brody and Elsa below as he makes his way. Indy then rushes back down the staircase with urgency and advances decisively to the central tile where the two sides of the X converge in perfect intersection, marking a pivotal point in their quest.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A sleek limousine is stationed right next to a sophisticated private airliner, which prominently displays the Donovan corporate logo on its exterior. Inside the limo, Brody leans slightly forward to peer into the interior, where Donovan and Indy are seated. Indy takes the Grail Diary into his hands, gently opening it and carefully flipping through the pages with deliberate attention. As they embark on their journey, a visual map appears on the screen, sketching a detailed trajectory from the bustling cityscape of New York City to the historic canals of Venice, Italy. Upon arrival, Indy and Brody step carefully down from the Water Bus, their feet connecting softly with the Boat Landing, while nearby gondoliers skillfully maneuver their boats through the water's gentle currents. Abruptly, a woman, striking in her appearance with her blonde hair and bright, perceptive eyes, confidently approaches Indy, her gaze appraising him with a bold, flirtatious air. Indy, catching her expression, responds with a grin, clearly savoring the playful exchange. The woman then shifts her attention to Brody, who acknowledges her presence with a polite tip of his hat. Introducing herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider, she gracefully extends her hand toward Brody. Indy's grin subsides as Brody registers a moment of surprise. Together, Indy, Brody, and Elsa stroll along the narrow canal, flanked by buildings that rise on either side. As they traverse a bridge that arches over the canal, Indy deftly plucks a flower from a nearby street vendor and offers it to Elsa with a smooth gesture. In response, Elsa hands Indy a slip of paper, which he promptly passes on to Brody. Elsa leads them onward into a bustling piazza, where people mill about, some leisurely seated at tables before a large building, as they reach the foot of the library steps. Guiding them inside, Elsa's steps resonate with the rhythmic click of heels on the polished marble floor. Indy and Brody's eyes are drawn to the library's many stained-glass windows, admiring the colorful displays. Elsa directs their gaze to four massive marble columns stretching from floor to ceiling. Indy takes a moment to study the columns, his attention eventually captured by a stained-glass window ornamented with an image of a Crusades Knight, lingering thoughtfully before the window. Once Elsa is out of earshot, Indy quickly retrieves the Grail Diary, flipping it open to scrutinize the sketch he had noted during their flight. Brody casts a glance at both the Diary and the window, realizing that the Roman numerals they seek form part of the window's intricate design. Indy's eyes dance across the library's walls and ceilings, animated by the thrill of discovery as they follow the ascending lines of one of the towering marble columns. With a sudden gesture, he points to the stained-glass window, uncovering that each column bears a corresponding Roman numeral. Eager to explore, Indy makes his way hurriedly toward Column VII, gesturing once more toward the stained-glass window before consulting the scrap of paper clutched in his hands. He navigates past rows of shelves brimming with books, pausing briefly before turning to gaze downward. Ascending a spiral staircase with purpose, he reaches a loft, taking a moment to look down at Brody and Elsa below. In a rush of determination, Indy descends the staircase, moving decisively to the specific center tile where the two lines of the X intersect, marking the spot crucial to their quest.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
A limo parked beside a Donovan-branded private airliner sets the scene as Brody peers inside, observing Donovan and Indy, who examines the Grail Diary. Their journey from New York City to Venice, Italy, is depicted on a map. Arriving in Venice, Indy and Brody disembark a Water Bus onto the Boat Landing amidst gondoliers. A striking blonde woman with bright, intelligent eyes approaches Indy flirtatiously. Enjoying the exchange, Indy grins while Brody tips his hat as the woman introduces herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider. Indyâ€™s grin fades as Brody registers surprise. Together, Indy, Brody, and Elsa stroll along the canal and cross a bridge. Indy playfully takes a flower from a vendor and offers it to Elsa, who passes him a slip of paper that Indy hands to Brody.

They proceed to a bustling piazza, reaching the library steps. Inside, their heels echo on the marble floor as Indy and Brody admire the stained-glass windows. Elsa points out four massive marble columns, and Indy lingers at a window depicting a Crusader Knight. Seizing a moment alone, Indy refers to the Grail Diary, comparing a sketch with the window. Brody's glance confirms Roman numerals integrate with the window's design. Excited, Indy's gaze sweeps the columns, noting each bears a Roman numeral. He advances to Column VII, correlating it with the window and scrap of paper in his hands. Moving past shelves, he stops to climb a spiral staircase to a loft, looking down at Brody and Elsa before hurrying back to the central tile where the sides of the X converge.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
A sleek limo, typically reserved for VIPs, is parked beside a private airliner that bears the prominent Donovan corporate logo, known in the business world for its ventures in oil and technology. Brody peers inside to Donovan and Indy, who opens the legendary Grail Diary, an artifact said to be connected to the Holy Grail, and thoughtfully turns through the pages. Their journey is SUPERIMPOSED over a map tracing a course from the bustling streets of New York City, a global hub for finance and culture, to Venice, Italy, famous for its intricate network of canals and Renaissance art. 

Indy and Brody disembark from the Water Bus, part of Venice's unique public transportation system, onto the Boat Landing as other gondoliers, who often sing traditional Italian songs, steer their boats in the water. Suddenly, a woman with attractive features, blonde hair, and bright, intelligent eyes approaches Indy, looking at him with an appraising expression that is brazenly flirtatious, reminiscent of the romantic charm often associated with the city. Indy grins, enjoying the repartee. The woman turns to Brody, who tips his hat in a gesture evoking the gentlemanly manners of a bygone era. She introduces herself as Dr. Elsa Schneider, a name that suggests a background in European academia, and extends her hand to Brody. Indy's grin fades, and Brody registers a look of surprise. Indy, Brody, and Elsa walk along the narrow canal, lined with centuries-old buildings on either side that speak to Venice's rich architectural heritage. 

As they cross over a bridge to the opposite side of the canal, Indy steals a flower from a street vendor, a customary gesture symbolizing affection, and holds it out to Elsa. She hands Indy a slip of paper, which he then extends to Brody. Elsa leads them into a large piazza, a quintessential feature of Italian cities where public life thrives, where people walk about and sit at tables in front of a large building, arriving at the front steps of the library, a structure likely housing historical texts and knowledge. Elsa leads the way inside, and their heels click across the marble floor, echoing in the vast space. Indy and Brody notice that the library contains many stained-glass windows, often used in past centuries to convey religious stories. Elsa indicates four huge marble columns that go from floor to ceiling, architectural elements that support the building's structure. Indy glances at the columns, then notices a stained-glass window depicting a Knight of the Crusades, perhaps a nod to the historical quests for the Holy Grail, lingering for a moment in front of the window.

Once Elsa is out of earshot, Indy quickly whips out the Grail Diary and opens it to the sketch he noticed on the airplane. Brody glances at the Diary and then at the window, noticing that the Roman numerals in question are part of the window's design, a clever integration of ancient symbols. Indy's eyes dart across the walls and ceilings, charged with the thrill of discovery as they travel up one of the four huge marble columns. He points to the stained-glass window, discovering that each column is numbered with a Roman numeral, an old-world numbering system still used for its classical elegance. Indy hurries toward Column VII, points again to the stained-glass window, and looks down at the scrap of paper in his hands, which holds a key piece of the puzzle. He walks past aisles of book-lined shelves, reminiscent of a scholar's paradise, stops, turns, and looks down. He climbs a spiral staircase leading up to a loft, offering a bird's-eye view of the library, looking down at Brody and Elsa. Indy then rushes down the staircase and goes to the center tile where the two sides of the X intersect, a potential focal point for their exploration.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Elsa leads them into a large piazza where people walk about and sit at tables in front of a large building. arriving at the front steps of the library Elsa leads the way inside and their heels click across the marble floor. Indy and Brody notice that the library contains many stainedglass windows. Elsa indicates four huge marble columns that go from floor to ceiling. Indy glances at the columns then notices a stainedglass window depicting a Knight of the Crusades lingering for a moment in front of the window. Once Elsa is out of earshot Indy quickly whips out the Grail Diary and opens it to the sketch he noticed on the airplane. Brody glances at the Diary and then at the window noticing that the Roman numerals in question are part of the window's design. Indy's eyes dart across the walls and ceilings charged with the thrill of discovery as they travel up one of the four huge marble columns. He points to the stainedglass window discovering that each column is numbered with a Roman numeral. Indy hurries toward Column VII points again to the stainedglass window and looks down at the scrap of paper in his hands. He walks past aisles of booklined shelves stops turns and looks down. He climbs a spiral staircase leading up to a loft looking down at Brody. and Elsa. Indy then rushes down the staircase and goes to the center tile where the two sides of the X intersect.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: A limo is parked beside a private airliner that bears the Donovan corporate logo. Brody peers inside to Donovan and Indy who opens the Grail Diary and thoughtfully turns through the pages. Their journey is SUPERIMPOSED. over a map tracing a course from New York City to Venice Italy. Indy and Brody disembark from the Water Bus onto the Boat Landing as other gondoliers steer their boats in the water. Suddenly a woman with attractive features blonde hair and bright intelligent eyes approaches Indy looking at him with an appraising expression that is brazenly flirtatious. Indy grins enjoying the repartee. Indy's eyes dart across the walls and ceilings charged with the thrill of discovery as they travel up one of the four huge marble columns. He points to the stainedglass window discovering that each column is numbered with a Roman numeral. Indy hurries toward Column VII points again to the stainedglass window and looks down at the scrap of paper in his hands. He walks past aisles of booklined shelves stops turns and looks down. He climbs a spiral staircase leading up to a loft looking down at Brody. and Elsa. Indy then rushes down the staircase and goes to the center tile where the two sides of the X intersect.

Brody peers inside to Donovan and Indy who opens the Grail Diary and thoughtfully turns through the pages. Their journey is SUPERIMPOSED. He climbs a spiral staircase leading up to a loft looking down at Brody. and Elsa. Indy then rushes down the staircase and goes to the center tile where the two sides of the X intersect.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A tricycle is stationed beside a military jet that displays the Rodriguez family crest. Molly squints inside to Rodriguez and Alex, who cracks open the Treasure Journal and absentmindedly flips through the illustrations. Their adventure is PROJECTED over a globe mapping a path from Chicago to Paris, France. Alex and Molly alight from the Tram Boat onto the Yacht Dock as other captains paddle their kayaks in the bay. Abruptly, a man with striking features, brown hair, and sharp, cunning eyes sidles up to Alex, glancing at him with a calculated demeanor that is overtly teasing. Alex smirks, savoring the banter. The man turns to Molly, who adjusts her scarf. He introduces himself as Mr. Otto Frank and presents a card to Molly. Alex's smirk vanishes, and Molly registers an expression of bewilderment. Alex, Molly, and Otto stroll along the crowded harbor, bordered by vendors on either side. As they traverse a walkway to the other side of the wharf, Alex snatches a coin from a beggar and offers it to Otto. He hands Alex a fragment of parchment, which he then reveals to Molly. Otto guides them into a bustling marketplace where merchants haggle and stand by carts in front of a towering statue, arriving at the base of the monument. Otto leads the path inside, and their footsteps echo across the tile floor. Alex and Molly observe that the monument features several ornate ceiling murals. Otto gestures to three grand granite pillars that stretch from floor to dome. Alex peers at the pillars, then spots a ceiling mural showing a Viking Warrior, pausing briefly before the mural. Once Otto is out of earshot, Alex swiftly retrieves the Treasure Journal and flips it to the illustration he spotted on the spaceship. Molly peeks at the Journal and then at the mural, noticing that the Arabic numerals involved are part of the mural's motif. Alex's gaze darts across the walls and floors, charged with the rush of revelation as they scale one of the three grand granite pillars. He gestures to the ceiling mural, deducing that each pillar is labeled with an Arabic numeral. Alex dashes toward Pillar V, gestures again to the ceiling mural, and gazes at the fragment of parchment in his grip. He strides past rows of artifact-laden cases, pauses, pivots, and peers downward. He ascends a ladder leading to a balcony, peering down at Molly and Otto. Alex then races down the ladder and proceeds to the central mosaic where the two branches of the Y converge.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A limo sits beside a private airliner with the Donovan logo. Brody looks inside at Donovan and Indy, who examines the Grail Diary. Their journey is tracked over a map from New York to Venice. Disembarking in Venice, Indy and Brody encounter a flirtatious woman, Dr. Elsa Schneider, who introduces herself to them. As they walk along a canal, Indy gives Elsa a flower, and she hands him a slip of paper. Elsa guides them to a library with stained-glass windows and marble columns. Indy notices a window depicting a Knight of the Crusades, matching a sketch from the Diary. He discovers Roman numerals on each column, becoming excited by the discovery. Indy rushes to Column VII, compares a scrap of paper, and climbs a spiral staircase. He then descends and moves to the center tile where the two sides of the X intersect.
